CatDescriptText: Mr. "Buzz" Scott, operator, radio and appliance shop, 2110 Wylie Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 29, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe the state and city FEPC laws are helping Negroes to get jobs they never held before?" answer reads: "Negroes have a few jobs they never had before, but I think it should be better."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of "Buzz" Scott, wearing eyeglasses, light colored shirt with dark item in left breast pocket, and wristwatch, standing in interior of radio and appliance shop, 2110 Wylie Avenue
